title: Pocket set theory
summary: Pocket set theory (PST) is an alternative set theory in which there are only two infinite cardinal numbers, â„µ0 (aleph-naught, the cardinality of the set of all natural numbers) and c (the cardinality of the continuum). The theory was first suggested by Rudy Rucker in his Infinity and the Mind.[1] The details set out in this entry are due to the American mathematician Randall M. Holmes.
